title: Geometry Pedagogy Development Project for Enhancing Spatial Cognition

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of elementary geometry concepts (basic properties of plane and solid figures)
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers focusing on developing field-applicable teaching methodologies, incorporating individual device use and collaborative learning environments

learning_goals: Systematic enhancement of geometric thinking expression capabilities according to Van Hiele theory's 5-level framework (visualization-analysis-abstraction-informal deduction-formal deduction)

Learners can design ≥3 practical activities transforming 3D objects (rectangular prisms, cylinders, etc.) via rotation (90°, 180°), symmetry (mirror reflection), and projection (front/side/top views) on 2D planes, achieving an average ≥4.0 on a 5-point peer evaluation rubric (clarity, accuracy, creativity).
Acquire learner diagnostic skills using spatial cognition measurement tools (spatial relations tests, mental rotation assessments)

Learners can develop three lesson plans addressing 5th–6th grade geometry concepts (area, volume, angles) using IBL (Instructional-Based Learning) strategies, submitting designs meeting ≥4 of the 5 evaluation criteria from peer reviews and expert assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
